title: There's no such thing as a strong pick to the community anymore its either "unplayable"or"overpwerd"
body:
I've seen this shit for almost a year now.
When a champion comes even close to the spotlight people want them nerfed.

Think about urgot. 
Awhile ago he was a strong adc pick.

Then people complained he "had no counterplay" and NEEDed a nerf.

Now people complain riot shows no love to urgot.

Serioulsy it's and endless cycle 

It's probably never going to stop too because instead of waiting for people to find a counter they want instant nerf and instant gratification..

Let the vicious cycle continue

People who are content with how the game is and how it plays as it is now generally don't come to the Gameplay and Balance Boards, they usually have no reason to, but very loud people who have very strong opinions almost always come to the Gameplay and Balance Boards to speak out their thoughts on Gameplay and Balance, and as you've seen, it gets pretty vicious when it gets there.

The problem is not the fact that people complain about champs being OP, it's the problem that there are certain champs you are pretty aware that Riot seems to adore and not care about any others. 

See Ahri, who got almost immediate buffs after the removal of Deathfire Grasp. Meanwhile changes to other champs like Veigar and Mordekaiser are "in the works"

As for Singed, they sing-nificantly buffed his ultimate at level 3 and gave him increased utility with the fling ooze combo.

Thank you! I never come on these boards but today I'm bored at work. I didn't realize how many complaining noobs there are so frustrated with their lack of skill that they come on here to cry about it. It's not the champion pool's fault or riot's that people can't climb ELO. I was only Gold V last season after 4 years of playing this fucking game. This season I finally realized a lot of my own personal issues with the game. I had bad luck in my promos and made some bad duo decisions and placed Bronze I. Guess what?? I was out in a day. Guess what? It's been 2 weeks and I'm already in Silver II. Guess what???? I'll be back to Gold in no time and this time with a different mindset. The mindset of what can I do to better carry my team? What can I do to keep my team from flaming eachother? What can i do to win this game that we are behind in? Then you do it. You watch streams, you watch the LCS, you read guides, you become a better player and a better person. You don't complain, blame (other players or riot for nerfing your champ). I will be plat this season......and guess what......? Plat isn't even good, but I'll be fucking happy with it because I am growing as a player.

Grow as a player or continue to bitch, moan, and ultimately lose most of your rank games where you were 10/1/5 at one point but now you're 10/10/10 and you lost. That used to be me. Not anymore.

I could continue but then people would probably start nitpicking so I'll just cut it here.

* After Lucian got gutted, Graves rose to the top of what he does, because Lucian was taken out of the picture.
* Morgana I agree is OP, and people have constantly whined about reducing her root's cooldown.
* Janna has been nerfed already, and is getting a huge passive nerf on the PBE.
* Nami doesn't need a nerf just because Riot made Sona shit.  This is the problem with revolving door nerfs, you can't tell who's really OP and who's simply filling a gap made by a champion that was fucking destroyed.
* Orianna is useless in solo queue.  She's big in the LC$ for utility, but that's because they're professional teams who kinda have to work together.
* I can't remember the last time someone called Rumble OP.  All he really has is his ultimate.
* Vi got indirectly buffed with the new jungle, but also nerfed with certain itemization removal.  She's strong, but not broken, just annoying as fuck to play against if she knows what she's doing.
* Wut?  Sivir?  Are you serious?
* Corki got nerfed hard.  I personally never liked Corki in the first place.
* Caitlyn hasn't been a problem since the itemization rework.  If you posted this in Season 3, I would have wholeheartedly agreed with you because there was a Caitlyn every game.
* Irelia's kit is just textbook overloaded.  They have an excuse to nerf her since she's part of the ongoing "fighter rework" so they can gut her and talk about how she's on the backburner for the next 3 years.

Woah, I think the rank-shaming was completely unnecessary for this one.

Corki has a 57.6% pick/ban rate in LCK.
Rumble has a 50% pick/ban rate in LCK.
Sivir has 45%
Morgana has 36%
Nami has 24%

Those are not "just his opinion/elo" it's what the Korean competitive meta believes are strong picks.

In fact, pretty much every region but NA realizes Rumble is an insanely strong pick, it's just that he's hard to master and doesn't do flashy stuff, so Americans don't really see the problem.

First it wasn't rank shaming. Meta is different from an elo to another. Don't beleive me ? Go play TF in bronze vs TF in diamond.

In bronze, you'll have a harder time making stuff happen vs in diamond because TF relies heavily on how your team reacts to stuff. (Now you can accuse me of rank shaming, but it's a fact, some characters are easier to climb with than others at different rank levels)

Second, Win rate has NOTHING to do with if it is a strong pick or not. As I said, Bronze TF vs Diamond TF. A higher win rate in solo queue only signifies that this champion has a good impact in **solo queue games**. The **exact same** applies to **competitive** play.

Third, opinion is also a thing. You have a different point of view on the situation than others. You have seen different games than others. It's not because **YOU** saw a strong Rumble that Rumble is a strong pick.

Fourth, other region might just have good rumble players / different team composition / different meta that allows to include Rumble more often. You can't judge competitive play between region, the "meta" differs largely from a place to another. Maybe NA is behind in the meta, maybe it's ahead. You don't know, I don't know no one knows, until there's an internationnal event.

And finally, if you really want an example, go see Hearthstone pro players. currently there are absolutely no "Meta" applied. Decks just comes and goes because you can build a viable deck that counters a **popular** deck currently.

Well, there was an international event last year if you don't remember, Imagine Dragons did a song for it and everything, and this event pretty much proved Korea is MILES AHEAD as far as meta is concerned. If the Korean competitive meta believes Rumble is strong enough that he deserves being picked/banned 50% of all games, he probably deserves his spot as a strong pick. 

In fact, most of the overwhelmingly strong champions in the competitive meta are not what the NA community complains about, Kassadin, Lulu, Rumble, Cassiopeia, these are the champions to be afraid of, but I keep seeing Yasuo threads in this day and age.

Solo-queue winrate is an indicator of well does a champ fare when played in low elo, since they make up the majority of the population, and I agree, it does not accurately indicate the real power of a champion, however, competitive statistics are an excellent indicator of a champions potential since it tells you how good the champion is when played by the very best players.

If you somehow don't think neither of those factors really prove that a certain champion pick is a strong pick then what do you believe in?, personal bias and experience?.

I have NEVER seen a good Rumble, few people actually play him, and even less people can master him, but I'm pretty sure he's a strong pick, because he's one of the most relevant competitive picks and his diamond winrate is huge.

Finally, Hearthstone is a young game, metas take a while to develop, specially in young eternal formats where each expansion pack changes like 30% of the card pool. Take a look at MTG Legacy meta, it has been there for such a long time, the relative card power is well known and you can accurately judge most strategies according to the meta, there are archetypes, counters to those archetypes, sideboard options and so on. I'd say a 120-champion game with like 8 champions released per year is old enough to develop a solid metagame.

An internationnal even which is months old and in which the game wasn't the same should not be taken into account. (Thanks to take me seriously and not try to roll me into mud, it would be appreciated.)

Competitive statistic are there for a small amount of players. Riot already stated they are balancing the for EVERYONE. It's completly false to say X character needs a nerf because he's picked or banned competitive wise. He needs attention. Not a pure nerf.

Rumble is a strong competitive pick in korea. And I said it, korea builds comp around him and other champions because there is a combo to be had. Competitive picks has **zero** indication of the health of a **single** character.

Hearthstone had strong metas in the past. Seasons in which there were 8 decks involved. Right now you can't tell if a Warlock is a Zoo, Control, Handlock, etc. until a few turns in. Agreed that league has place to developp a solid metagame, but it is not by blindly nerfing champs because "they are strong in Korea" that you'll acheive it. Korea has proven it more than once : they build strong TEAMS. We've seen it with Piglet - Impact and TIP coming to NA and doing close to nothing this season.

>Awhile ago he was a strong adc pick.

>Then people complained he "had no counterplay" and NEEDed a nerf.

>Now people complain riot shows no love to urgot.

There's a big misconception going around about this; **power is not the same as counterplay**.  Urgot overall has low counterplay, and when he's at equal strength to other champions in his role he is absurdly frustrating to play against.  He's still frustrating when he's numerically weaker, but it's less mind-numbingly terrible to face him.  

Yorick is another good example.  He has almost zero counterplay outside of "soak up his poke and win the duel", and when he's strong/viable it *sucks* to be against him.  This doesn't necessarily mean he's overpowered, but he is completely anti-fun and could probably use a nerf so he doesn't continually ruin games.

One final example, Evelynn.  Evelynn used to be (and somewhat still is) total bullshit.  She wasn't necessarily overpowered, but the amount of frustration and playstyle altering she forced was so overwhelming that Riot decided to smash her into nonexistence until they could get around to working on her.  Again, they didn't do this because she was too strong; they did this because she was too frustrating.

>It's probably never going to stop too because instead of waiting for people to find a counter they want instant nerf and instant gratification..

Many of the older champions just straight up don't have counterplay, or it's unreasonably imbalanced.  Blitzcrank is a pretty good example of this, because Rocket Grab's potential benefit is so far above its cost that it might as well be undodgeable.  If he lands a single good hook lategame, despite missing 400 of them previously, it could singlehandedly (c wut i did thar) win the game for his team.  Is he overpowered as a champion?  Probably not, but he has some pain points.
